text: flash floods and landslides triggered by a weekend tropical storm have killed at least 100 people in vietnam , the country 's news agency said monday . vietnamese villagers look at the rubble where 19 houses stood before a flash-flood ripped away the hamlet of tung chin in lao cai province . forecasters fear additional casualties as more rain was expected monday . the floods in the the country 's northern mountain provinces damaged tens of thousands of homes , swept away thousands of cattle and submerged crops , the vietnam news agency said . more than two dozen people remained missing . officials mobilized thousands of rescue workers to look for survivors and to carry relief to the areas hardest hit by the storm . tropical storm kammuri struck the northern provinces on friday . the southeast asian country is prone to heavy rainfall during the may through september monsoon season . the resulting landslides and floods have killed hundreds in past years .
